Forgive us for jumping to conclusions, but we imagine Tottenham Hotspur fans are pretty content with life at the moment. 
After their hard-fought victory over Southampton and over results going their way, they're now sitting in outright second in the table. 
They've also got a genuine chance of silverware this season, with a London derby against Chelsea in the FA Cup semi-final to look forward to next month. 
Oh - and then there's the small matter of the current crisis engulfing their bitter rivals Arsenal. (Photo: REUTERS) 
Now they've got another little bit of statistical gold to perk up their mood even further. 
After his goal in the Southampton home win, Christian Eriksen has extended his record as the most devastating long-range shooter in the Premier League. Number 13 coming up... (Photo: Warren Little) 
Since his debut in September 2013 , no player has scored as many goals in the division from outside the box as Eriksen - who has smashed in 13 in that time. 
That's above the likes of Yaya Toure, Philippe Coutinho and - enjoy this, Spurs fans - Alexis Sanchez. 
Take a look at the top ten in full: Premier League goals from outside the box Since September 2013 
Red-hot Tottenham are facing some huge games in the coming weeks as they seek to consolidate a Champions League spot - facing many teams fighting against relegation. 
So here's a little tip for their upcoming opponents... Do not give Eriksen space to shoot! poll loading Will Christian Eriksen be at Spurs next season? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
